text.18_Daf, 27_Line: I have heard that sacrifices may be brought even though there is no House, that one may eat the most holy foods even though there are no curtains, and foods of lesser sanctity and the second tithe may be eaten even though there is no wall,
text.18_Daf, 21_Line: After they came to Jerusalem, the high places were forbidden, and they were never permitted again, and it was the ‘inheritance’.

text.17_Daf, 47_Line: In both places the offerings of greatest holiness were eaten within the curtains.
text.17_Daf, 46_Line: MISHNAH. There is no difference between Shiloh and Jerusalem except that in Shiloh offerings of lesser holiness and the second tithe could be eaten anywhere within sight, while in Jerusalem they had to be eaten within the walls.
